name: Hearty Vegetable Soup
method: Heat a large pot over medium heat. Add carrots, celery, onion, and garlic. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add canned tomatoes (with juice), vegetable broth, bay leaves, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove bay leaves before serving.
description: A low-calorie, nutrient-dense soup that's perfect for any meal.

name: Quinoa Salad with Lemon Dressing
method: Rinse quinoa under cold running water. In a medium saucepan, combine quinoa with 2 cups water. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
Let quinoa cool, then fluff with a fork.
In a large bowl, combine quinoa, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Pour over the salad and toss to combine.
description: A refreshing and healthy quinoa salad, perfect for a quick lunch.

name: Baked Salmon with Asparagus
method: Place salmon and asparagus on a baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic, salt, and pepper.
Top with lemon slices and bake for 20 minutes, until salmon is opaque and asparagus is tender.
description: Simple and delicious baked salmon with asparagus.
